news.title: Nextdoor Eliminates Its Forward to Police Program
news.description: Following criticism of how it handles communications with law enforcement and racism on its platform, Nextdoor has removed a feature that lets users forward posts directly to local police.

news.title: How Social Media Has Changed Civil Rights Protests
news.description: The role of social media in today’s protests parallels the role of traditional media in the 1960s Civil Rights movement, but differences include social media’s broader reach and efficiency.

news.title: Facebook Goes After Companies for Fake Likes & Comments
news.description: Facebook is pursuing coordinated lawsuits against software makers in the US and Europe based on their distribution of fake likes and comments on both Facebook and Instagram.

news.title: Facebook and Twitter Remove Manipulated Video From President’s Accounts After DMCA Complaint
news.description: A doctored video of an earlier viral post uploaded to Trump’s Facebook and Twitter accounts has been taken down after DMCA notices were filed with both platforms by rights holders.
